repo_notes.content: Only the *.md files should be analyzed and documented.
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

repo_notes.content: Ignore all other file types. - Ignore folders starting with a dot (`.`).
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

repo_notes.content: The documentation is for SharpMUSH, which can be found here: [https://github.com/SharpMUSH/SharpMUSH] and here: [https://sharpmush.com/].
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

repo_notes.content: Do not cover, nor document the SharpMUSH github submodule repo.
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

repo_notes.content: Do not cover, nor document the automation for transforming documentation.
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

repo_notes.content: Only focus on the *.md files that cover the actual softcode.
repo_notes.author: Harry Cordewener

pages.title: Overview
pages.purpose: Introduce the SharpMUSH.Guide repository, documenting the SharpMUSH project, and provide a high-level understanding of the architecture of the DSL language for SharpMUSH (also referred to as Softcode)

pages.title: SharpMUSH Command Documentation
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of the SharpMUSH command system structure and the four main command categories documented in this repository

pages.title: SharpMUSH Function Documentation
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of the SharpMUSH function system structure and categories documented in this repository

pages.title: SharpMUSH Function List
pages.purpose: Provides a full list of functions and documentation.

pages.title: SharpMUSH Command List
pages.purpose: Provides a full list of commands and documentation.

pages.title: SharpMUSH Configuration Documentation
pages.purpose: Provide an overview of the SharpMUSH configuration options documented in this repository

pages.title: @-ATTRIBUTES Commands
pages.purpose: Document the 60+ attribute commands that follow a three-version pattern (base, object-specific, action-specific) for setting messages and properties on objects

pages.title: @-BUILDING Commands
pages.purpose: Detail the 27 building commands that manage object lifecycle, access control, and relationships within the MUD/MUSH environment

pages.title: @-GENERAL Commands
pages.purpose: Explain the 40+ general utility commands covering programmatic control, communication, and system information

pages.title: @-WIZARD Commands
pages.purpose: Document the 38+ administrative commands restricted to wizard/privileged users for system control, user management, and resource allocation

pages.title: Event-Driven Attributes
pages.purpose: Explain attributes that trigger actions based on events like connections, disconnections, name changes, and sound detection

pages.title: Object Interaction Attributes
pages.purpose: Document attributes that control interactions with objects including buying, dropping, describing, and cloning

pages.title: Special Commands and Modifiers
pages.purpose: Cover specialized commands including speech modification, suggestion systems, and the null comment operator

pages.title: Network and System Commands
pages.purpose: Document commands for HTTP operations, socket configuration, and daemon management
